abstract: Google and Intel are leading a consortium of companies in an effort to reduce the amount of power wasted by personal computers.
snippet: Google and Intel are leading a consortium of companies in an effort to reduce the amount of power wasted by personal computers.
lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., June 12 — Google and Intel are leading a consortium of major technology companies in an effort to sharply reduce the amount of power wasted by personal computers and servers.

headline.main: Technology Group Seeks to Save Power
headline.print_headline: Technology Group Seeks to Save Power

abstract: Addressing privacy concerns, the company announced that it would keep search histories of users for only 18 months instead of 24.
snippet: Addressing privacy concerns, the company announced that it would keep search histories of users for only 18 months instead of 24.
lead_paragraph: PARIS, June 12  Faced with criticism from privacy activists and questions from the European Union, Google announced on Tuesday that it would cut back on how long it keeps the Web search histories of users, to 18 months from 24.

headline.main: Google to Reduce History of Personal Searches
headline.print_headline: Google to Reduce History of Personal Searches

abstract: Openads, a supplier of open-source online advertising software, has received $5 million in initial venture funding from a group led by Index Ventures. Openads’ ad-server technology competes with DoubleClick, which Google recently acquired, but at a different end of the market, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Openads, a supplier of open-source online advertising software, has received $5 million in initial venture funding from a group led by Index Ventures. Openads’ ad-server technology competes with DoubleClick, which Google recently acquired, but at a different end of the market, Reuters reported.

abstract: Venture-backed initial public offerings had their best month in years last month as 11 companies raised $1.6 billion from I.P.O.s on American exchanges. That figure represents the most money raised since August 2004 when the debut of Google raised that figure to nearly $1.9 billion, according to statistics released Tuesday by Thomson Financial and the National Venture Capital Association.
lead_paragraph: Venture-backed initial public offerings had their best month in years last month as 11 companies raised $1.6 billion from I.P.O.s on American exchanges. That figure represents the most money raised since August 2004 when the debut of Google raised that figure to nearly $1.9 billion, according to statistics released Tuesday by Thomson Financial and the National Venture Capital Association.

headline.main: May Is Banner Month for Venture-Backed I.P.O.’s
